HI @wsycqyz  
after this PR merged, when we run the test case from the sonic-mgmt docker, it there any change comaring to the previous method?

Thanks

Hi @nhe-NV 
Generally speaking, there is no change when running test case.
All test cases listed in "tests/python3_test_files.txt" will run in Python3 environment.
If you remove the test case file name from "tests/python3_test_files.txt", the test case will run in Python2 environment.

it's possible that you may come across some test case failures due to this PR. I want to acknowledge that the Python 2 to 3 migration process can be a challenging and arduous one, and it's not uncommon to encounter unexpected issues along the way.

Please know that I am available to address any concerns you may have. Please don't hesitate to reach out to me if you need any assistance or have any questions.

> 

Thanks @wsycqyz 
Currently I know that for the test cases listed in the python3_test_files.txt need to run with "/var/AzDevOps/env-python3/bin/py.test", and for other test cases it will run with py.test directly.

So in your scenario, you will check if the test case is in the python3_test_files.txt, and then decide which py.test will be used to run the test, is it correct?

and finally we will move all the test cases from python2 to python3, right?

Thanks

Hi @nhe-NV 
Your understanding is correct. Now when you run run_test.sh, it will check if the test case is in the python3_test_files.txt, and then decide which Python will be used to run the test.

And yes, finally we will move all the test cases from Py2 to Py3, and remove Python2 from the sonic-mgmt docker totally.

In our internal runs, we are seeing that testcase ipfwd/test_dir_bcast.py is failing when we run with the latest sonic-mgmt code.
 
The failure is happening in below function.
def get_ptf_src_ports(topo_type, tbinfo, duthost):
    # Source ports are upstream ports
    upstream_neightbor_name = UPSTREAM_NEIGHBOR_MAP[topo_type]
    ptf_src_ports = get_neighbor_ptf_port_list(duthost, upstream_neightbor_name, tbinfo)
    return ptf_src_ports
 
Here, UPSTREAM_NEIGHBOR_MAP directory in tests.common.helpers.constants does not have t0-64 as a key. this change was introduced by a recent upstream PR
https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/7730
This PR is affecting an existing testcase which was passing before

We run this logic locally on different setups for ~1 month - it's stable on our side.

Wasn't there a similar effort done in PR https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/7226?

Also, with regards to selecting the right ports, we have another PR https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/6946 - which tries to address running these tests in multi-asic/multi-dut scenario. [Here,](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/blob/c92fa2bd24a79740164c9b361712a41245ac977b/tests/qos/test_qos_sai.py#L761) we addressed the issue resolved by PR#7226 by picking ports from selected testPortIds.  Do you think the approach in PR#6946 would work to resolve issue in PR#7226 as well as this PR?

> 

This PR (#7572) refact "correctPortIds" function in PR #7226, make it more generic. and it works for below use cases:

- test port in qos topology is out of date
unexpected port come from: qos.yml::qos_params/{platform}/{asic}/{topology}/[src|dst]_port_id[s]
previous PR #7226 only process this use case.

- test port in qos profile is out of date
unexpected port come from: qos.yml::qos_params/{platform}/{asic}/{topology}/{port-speed-cable-len}/{profile}/[src|dst]_port_id[s]
This PR #7572 can handle this use case as well, and only wiht one line invoking, as below:
self.updateTestPortIdIp(dutConfig, qosConfig[LosslessVoqProfile])

The current testing logic is always add ACL rules, and then removing them all. Can we also add a scenario, where we delete some of the existing rules, and then append some rules? It's because we never clear all rules in production. We are always deleting/updating/appending. Thanks

This PR may cause error for some test cases, such as `test_tunnel_decap_dscp_to_pg_mapping`.
```
ERROR\n\n======================================================================\error: sai_qos_tests.TunnelDscpToPgMapping\n
----------------------------------------------------------------------\n
Traceback (most recent call last):\n
  File "saitests/sai_qos_tests.py", line 788, in runTest\n
    stats = show_stats('just collect base data', self, self.test_params.get('sonic_asic_type', None), self.test_params.get('test_port_ids', None), silent=True)\n
  File "saitests/sai_qos_tests.py", line 172, in show_stats\n
    results. Append(show_counter('PtfCnt', ptftest, asic_type, ports, current=None, base=base, indexes=None, banner=banner, silent=silent)[0])\n
  File "saitests/sai_qos_tests.py", line 146, in show_counter\n
    for pidx, port in enumerate(ports):\nTypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable\n\n
```
It's because we don't have `test_port_ids` as param.

Copy my comments from https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/pull/12678 :

I create following PR to validate this change:
https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/pull/12983

As you can see, after enable this feature, every UT failed in 'prepare testbed' stage:
https://dev.azure.com/mssonic/build/_build/results?buildId=185495&view=logs&j=a35c5435-5100-57cf-f655-60b256043d84&t=c9f737d3-1e43-5e60-26d7-f79fbfea8dbb

I'm didn't check detail of why that step failed, but I think that step failed because current code trying to login but not reset password.

I suggest fix UT break issue in sonic-mgmt before this PR merge. the fix can reuse the logic in check_install.py.

Current UT PR only add new UT to cover this feature, but existed UTs will break when this feature enabled.
